delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

contact.description: Device contact information, often an email.

description.description: Description of the user defined system profile.

virtual-mac.description:
Global virtual MAC configuration. An example usage would be EVPN
Symmetric IRB where EVPN advertises this MAC as the Router's
MAC for all the EVPN Symmetric Routes.

disable-factory-reset.description:
Prevent the manual hard reset to factory default by pressing down
and holding the reset button.

internal-vlan-range.description: Specifies the starting and ending VLAN number for the range.

mac-age-time.description: MAC age time or how long the MAC address remains in the MAC table.

mac-address-delimiter.description: The character used to separate the digits of the MAC address.

enable-unsupported-transceiver.description: Allow or Disallow transceivers that are recognized as unsupported to be operational.

unsupported-transceiver-logging-interval.description: Configure the logging interval for allowed unsupported transceivers feature.

unsupported-transceiver-logging.description: Enable or Disable unsupported transceiver logging.

max-vlan.description: Configure the maximum number of VLANs allowed on the device.

management-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

primary-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

loop-protect.description: Loop protect profile to be applied.

dot1x-auth.description: Container for 802.1X authentication attributes, used to enable or disable 802.1X features.

mac-auth.description: Container for MAC authentication attributes, used to enable or disable MAC authentication.

web-auth.description: Container for Web authentication attributes, used to enable or disable Web based authentication.

user-role.description: Container for aaa authorization user-role global attributes.

dynamic-arp-inspection.description:
Configuration of Dynamic ARP Inspection.
Dynamic ARP Inspection is defense mechanism can be put in place on a switch to protect
against various possible attacks using ARP. This can limit the amount of ARP activity
allowed from a host or on a port and can also ensure all ARP packets are consistent
with one or more binding database which can be created via various means.
It can also enforce integrity checks on the ARP packets to check against using
different MAC or IP in the Ethernet or IP header and the ARP header.

validate-destination-mac.description: Validate destination MAC address in ARP request

validate-ip.description: Validate source IP address in ARP request

validate-source-mac.description: Validate source MAC address in ARP request

port-security.description: Container for the port security configurations.

fastboot.description:
Enable/Disable fastboot for the system. When fastboot is enabled,
Most of the test under POST will be skipped. POST (Power On Self Test)
verifies the hardware functionality of various modules (subsystem/
line modules/ fabric module / interfaces) during boot-up.

policy-in.description: The policy name for inbound (Ingress) traffic.

hw-resource-share-enable.description:
Enable hardware resource sharing for private VLAN secondary ports.
This configuration is applicable for certain AOS-CX switches only.
This configuration is available from 10.14 switch firmware version
and it is enabled by default. This configuration helps to get more
private VLAN secondary ports.

ethertype.x-typeDescription: QinQ ether types either Ethertype 8100 or Ethertype 88A8.
ethertype.description: The QinQ ethertype configuration. This is supported only in certain CX switches

vlan-mode.x-typeDescription: The QinQ (802.1Q-in-802.1Q) VLAN modes either S-VLAN or mixed VLAN mode.

tag-type.description: The QinQ tag type in hexadecimal, must have QinQ VLAN mode configuration.

dfp-cppm-timer.description: Configures the timer for AOS-S switch to send the client data to ClearPass.

default-device-type-associations.description: List of supported device types configuration for switch system

supported-device-type.x-typeDescription: Default Device types for device profile association
supported-device-type.description: Specify an approved device-type in order to configure and attach a profile to it.

device-profile-ref.description: Associate a profile with this device-type.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

contact.description: Device contact information, often an email.

description.description: Description of the user defined system profile.

Global virtual MAC configuration. An example usage would be EVPN
Symmetric IRB where EVPN advertises this MAC as the Router's
MAC for all the EVPN Symmetric Routes.

disable-factory-reset.description:
Prevent the manual hard reset to factory default by pressing down
and holding the reset button.

internal-vlan-range.description: Specifies the starting and ending VLAN number for the range.

mac-age-time.description: MAC age time or how long the MAC address remains in the MAC table.

mac-address-delimiter.description: The character used to separate the digits of the MAC address.

enable-unsupported-transceiver.description: Allow or Disallow transceivers that are recognized as unsupported to be operational.

unsupported-transceiver-logging-interval.description: Configure the logging interval for allowed unsupported transceivers feature.

unsupported-transceiver-logging.description: Enable or Disable unsupported transceiver logging.

max-vlan.description: Configure the maximum number of VLANs allowed on the device.

management-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

primary-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

loop-protect.description: Loop protect profile to be applied.

dot1x-auth.description: Container for 802.1X authentication attributes, used to enable or disable 802.1X features.

mac-auth.description: Container for MAC authentication attributes, used to enable or disable MAC authentication.

web-auth.description: Container for Web authentication attributes, used to enable or disable Web based authentication.

user-role.description: Container for aaa authorization user-role global attributes.

dynamic-arp-inspection.description:
Configuration of Dynamic ARP Inspection.
Dynamic ARP Inspection is defense mechanism can be put in place on a switch to protect
against various possible attacks using ARP. This can limit the amount of ARP activity
allowed from a host or on a port and can also ensure all ARP packets are consistent
with one or more binding database which can be created via various means.
It can also enforce integrity checks on the ARP packets to check against using
different MAC or IP in the Ethernet or IP header and the ARP header.

validate-destination-mac.description: Validate destination MAC address in ARP request

validate-ip.description: Validate source IP address in ARP request

validate-source-mac.description: Validate source MAC address in ARP request

port-security.description: Container for the port security configurations.

fastboot.description:
Enable/Disable fastboot for the system. When fastboot is enabled,
Most of the test under POST will be skipped. POST (Power On Self Test)
verifies the hardware functionality of various modules (subsystem/
line modules/ fabric module / interfaces) during boot-up.

policy-in.description: The policy name for inbound (Ingress) traffic.

hw-resource-share-enable.description:
Enable hardware resource sharing for private VLAN secondary ports.
This configuration is applicable for certain AOS-CX switches only.
This configuration is available from 10.14 switch firmware version
and it is enabled by default. This configuration helps to get more
private VLAN secondary ports.

ethertype.x-typeDescription: QinQ ether types either Ethertype 8100 or Ethertype 88A8.
ethertype.description: The QinQ ethertype configuration. This is supported only in certain CX switches

vlan-mode.x-typeDescription: The QinQ (802.1Q-in-802.1Q) VLAN modes either S-VLAN or mixed VLAN mode.

tag-type.description: The QinQ tag type in hexadecimal, must have QinQ VLAN mode configuration.

dfp-cppm-timer.description: Configures the timer for AOS-S switch to send the client data to ClearPass.

default-device-type-associations.description: List of supported device types configuration for switch system

supported-device-type.x-typeDescription: Default Device types for device profile association
supported-device-type.description: Specify an approved device-type in order to configure and attach a profile to it.

device-profile-ref.description: Associate a profile with this device-type.

icmp.description:
ICMP Configurations.
The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used
by network devices, including routers, to send error
messages and operational information indicating,
for example, that a requested service is not available
or that a host or router could not be reached.

redirect.description: Enable sending ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 redirect messages.

unreachable.description: Enable sending ICMPv4 and ICMPv6 destination unreachable messages.

throttle.description:
ICMP throttle (in seconds) is used to configure the packet
interval to send ICMPv4/v6 error and redirect messages.

burst-normal.description: Maximum number of ICMP replies to send per second.

echo-reply.description:
Enables echo replies to broadcast
echo requests.

ipv6-icmp-error-interval.description:
Interval at which to send
IPv6 ICMP error messages.

ipv6-icmp-bucket-size.description:
Bucket-size to send
ICMP error message.

tcp.description:
TCP Configurations.
In TCP 3-way handshake, the switch may respond back with
SYN-ACK which might never reach the intended destination.
These unestablished connections queue up, they can prevent
new, legitimate requests from being handled. Hence there
is a need to handle these half-open requests with a timeout
threshold which can be user tunable.

syn-ack-retry.description:
Number of times TCP SYN-ACK packets are
resent in response to a TCP SYN request.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Time rule none, time will be in UTC.
x-enumDescriptions.CONTINENTAL_US_AND_CANADA: Daylight time rule US and Canada.
x-enumDescriptions.MIDDLE_EUROPE_AND_PORTUGAL: Daylight time rule Europe and Portugal.
x-enumDescriptions.USER_DEFINED: Daylight time rule as defined by the user.

begin-date.description: System daylight time begin date when the daylight time rule is user defined.

end-date.description: System daylight time end date when the daylight time rule is user defined.

log-enable.description: Enable ACL logging. Enabled by default

log-timer.description: Sets the log timer interval for all ACEs that have the log parameter configured.

secure-update.description: Secure update determines if access lists are updated using the secure-update feature. Secure-update is enabled by default.

deny-fragmented-tcp-header.description: Configure the switch to drop all IPv4 and IPv6 packets containing a fragmented TCP header.

deny-non-classifiable-layer4-header.description: Configure the switch to drop all IPv6 packets for which the Layer 4 header cannot be processed by ACL hardware.

ArubaSwitchSystem_UserRole.description: Grouping for aaa authorization user-role global attributes configurations

download.description: Enables the downloadable user role feature.

x-enumDescriptions.MGMT_REDUNDANCY_NONE:
Allows to shut down a redundant management module that is not functioning
correctly without physically removing the module.

redundancy-mode.description: Redundant management redundancy mode when the platform is a 5406 or 5412.

preferred-active-module.description: Active management module preferred across reboot when the platform is a 5406 or 5412.

rapid-switchover.description:
Used when the platform is a 5406 or 5412 the time interval before route and
neighbor table entries are re-added to the Forwarding Information Base
on the active management module after a failover has occurred.

ArubaAaaDot1xauth_Dot1xauthSystemSwitchC.description: Group for 802.1X authenticator switch specific system configurations

eap-tls-fragment-size-towards-server.description:
Maximum size in bytes of an EAP-TLS fragment encoded in a single
RADIUS request packet.

radius-auth-method.description: The type of authentication method to use for authentication.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Do not use backup authentication methods.
x-enumDescriptions.CACHED: Retain current session attributes during reauthentication.

radius-server-group.description: RADIUS server group to use for authentication.

cached-reauth-delay.description: Period of time, in seconds, during which authenticator will not initiate reauthentications after a cached reauthentication.

ArubaAaaDot1xsupp_Dot1xsuppSystemSwitchC.description: Group for 802.1X supplicant switch specific system configurations.

x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE: Device certificate stored in the Trusted Platform Module (TPM)
x-enumDescriptions.EST: EST(Enrollment over Secure Transport protocol) certificate.

eap-tls-cert-type.description: The type of certificate to use for EAP-TLS authentication.

eap-tls-cert.description: The certificate to use for EAP-TLS authentication.

ArubaAaaMacauth_PasswordInfo.description: Group for  password to be used for authentication.

password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
password.description:
The plaintext password to be used for authentication in the
RADIUS request messages. This is applicable only when password
type is PLAIN_TEXT.

ciphertext-password.description:
The ciphertext password to be used for authentication in the
RADIUS request messages. This is applicable only when password
type is CIPHER_TEXT.

ArubaAaaMacauth_MacauthSystemSwitchConfi.description: Group for MAC authentication switch specific system configurations.

address-format.description:
The MAC address format to be used in the RADIUS request messages
for authentication.

macauth-password.description:
Enables and configures the global password that is used
for MAC authentication. The password can be either in
ciphertext or plaintext format.

radius-auth-method.description: The type of RADIUS authentication method to use for authentication.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Do not use backup authentication methods.
x-enumDescriptions.CACHED: Retain current session attributes during reauthentication.

radius-server-group.description: RADIUS server group to use for authentication.

ArubaAaaWebauth_WebauthSystemConfig.description: Group for Web authentication system-wide configuration.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

dhcp-addr.description: Configure DHCP address range for web authentication.

dhcp-lease.description: Configure DHCP lease time for web authentication.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

The domain-name type represents a DNS domain name.
Fully quallified left to the models which utilize this type.

Internet domain names are only loosely specified.  Section
3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in Section
2.1 of RFC 1123).  The pattern above is intended to allow
for current practice in domain name use, and some possible
future expansion.  It is designed to hold various types of
domain names, including names used for A or AAAA records
(host names) and other records, such as SRV records.  Note
that Internet host names have a stricter syntax (described
in RFC 952) than the DNS recommendations in RFCs 1034 and
1123, and that systems that want to store host names in
schema nodes using the domain-name type are recommended to
adhere to this stricter standard to ensure interoperability.

The encoding of DNS names in the DNS protocol is limited
to 255 characters.  Since the encoding consists of labels
prefixed by a length bytes and there is a trailing NULL
byte, only 253 characters can appear in the textual dotted
notation.

Domain-name values use the US-ASCII encoding.  Their canonical
format uses lowercase US-ASCII characters.  Internationalized
domain names MUST be encoded in punycode as described in RFC
3492

ewa-server-address.description: IP address or FQDN of the Ewa server.

page-path.description: Path to the authentication page on the external web authentication server.

radius-response.description: Use RADIUS server response as access denied message.

ArubaAaaProfile_AccountingSystemSwitchCo.description: Group for system level accounting configurations.

x-enumDescriptions.START_STOP: Send start and stop accounting record

local-accounting.description:
Enables local accounting for port-access clients in the system
when accounting-mode is START_STOP or STOP_ONLY.

interim-update-enable.description:
Enables the device to send interim network accounting updates
to the configured accounting server when accounting-mode is
START_STOP.

interim-update-interval.description:
Specifies the time interval(in minutes) between two successive
accounting updates sent to the server when interim update is
enabled.

interim-update-onreauth-enable.description:
Enables the device to send interim network accounting updates
to the configured accounting server on successful client
reauthentication when accounting-mode is START_STOP.

acct-server-group.description:
RADIUS server group to which accounting updates will be sent
when accounting-mode is START_STOP or STOP_ONLY.

ArubaAaaProfile_AuthenticationSystemSwit.description: Group for switch specific system level authentication configurations.

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLED:
Client can move between interfaces without authentication itself
on the new interface.
x-enumDescriptions.SECURE_ENABLED:
Client can move between interfaces but only after authenticating
itself on the new interface.

auto-vlan-enable.description:
Enable automatic creation of a VLAN for authenticated clients if the
VLAN is not already available on the device.

enable.description:
Enables caching authenticated clients and their associated
role information. Clients are assigned to their previously
authenticated role.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Specifies cache entry can't be overwritten till expiry.
x-enumDescriptions.FIFO: Specifies oldest cache entry can be replaced with new entry.

cache-replace-mode.description:
Replacement mode to be applied when cache limit is reached
and more clients have to be added to the cache.

cache-timeout.description:
The period of time in hours for which an authenticated
client's information will be cached.

persistent-storage-enable.description:
Enables writing cached client information to the device's
persistent storage unit.

persistent-storage-write-interval.description:
Interval between consecutive cached client information
writes to persistent storage file in seconds.
Flash write occurs only if there is a change in cached
client's information.

use-lldp-data.description: Authenticate clients using information from their LLDP packets.

allow-vlan-tagged.description:
Configure authenticator ports to apply VLAN changes immediately and
apply tagged VLAN membership changes immediately on AAA enabled ports.

ArubaMacsec_MacsecSystemConfig.description: Grouping for system level MACsec configurations.

selftest-enable.description: Enable MACsec selftest on the device.

traps-enable.description: Enable port-security violation traps on the system.

ArubaFaultMonitor_FaultMonitorSwitchSyst.description: Grouping reusable leaves to single group.

x-enumDescriptions.NOTIFY_AND_DISABLE: NOTIFY_AND_DISABLE - log an event and shutdown the port.

action.description:
Action to be performed when the faulty frame count
exceeds the configured threshold in a 30 second sampling interval.

ArubaLoopProtect_LoopProtectSwitchSystem.description:
Loop protect configuration.Loop protection can find loops in
untagged layer 2 links as well as tagged VLAN.

re-enable-timer.description: Time interval for enabling port blocked by loop-protect.

trap.description: Enable SNMP traps when a loop is detected by loop-protect.

x-enumDescriptions.PORT_MODE: Set loop protection to work on a port basis.
x-enumDescriptions.VLAN_MODE: Set loop protection to work on a VLAN basis.

mode.description: Sets whether loop-protect mode is either port based or vlan based.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description:
List of VLANs for sending loop-protect pdus(Protocol Data Unit)
for a port.

ArubaAuthServerGlobal_CppmIdentity.description:
Group for configuring username and password combination of ClearPass which
is used to login to ClearPass to download user roles

cppm-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
